Cereal growing accounts for 60% of the crops being grown at this time.The decision as to what crops to grow depends on many factors,economics being the major concern.However the acreage of potatoes and sugarbeet is strictly controlled by quota with heavy financial penalties for over- production - there is satellite surveillance of all crops grown! Other factors include crop rotation, soil condition and weed and desease control.Oilseed rape must have a four yearly rotation,but its growth does allow the farmer to effect sound weed control,especially of grasses.
